lines.text: It lacked certain elements that we need to market a film successfully.
What elements?
Suspense, laughter, violence. Hope, heart, nudity, sex. Happy endings. Mainly happy endings.
What about reality?
[Levy suggested that writers could be eliminated and any old news story could provide a movie story idea]
"Further Bond Losses Push Dow Down 7.15." I see Connery as Bond.
[Last lines]
What took you so long?
Traffic was a bitch.
I was just thinking what an interesting concept it is to eliminate the writer from the artistic process. If we could just get rid of these actors and directors, maybe we've got something here.
Mr. Mill, have you been going to detective school?
No, actually, we're doing a... a movie right now, called Lonely Room, and Scott Glenn plays a detective much like yourself.
Is he a black woman?
I'll be there right after my AA meeting.
Oh Larry, I didn't realise you had a drinking problem.
Well I don't really, but that's where all the deals are being made these days.
I like words and letters, but I'm not crazy about complete sentences.
I don't go to movies.
Why not?
Life is too short.
So, what's the story?

Twenty-five words or less? Okay. Movie exec calls writer. Writer's girlfriend says he's at the movies. Exec goes to the movies, meets writer, drinks with writer. Writer gets conked and dies in four inches of dirty water. Movie exec is in deep shit. What do you think?
That's more than 25 words and it's bullshit.
This is a red wine glass. Can I have my water in a water glass?
We can't hurry things any more than we can stop them.
Hey, you're Martin Scorsese!
No, but I know Harvey Keitel.
Of course you do! Hey, I loved Cape Fear!
Can we talk about something other than Hollywood for a change? We're educated people.
Griffin, you move in mysterious ways, but I like it! I like it!
No stars, just talent.
So you're saying if you drove a shitty car, you would park in the parking lot.
No, I'm saying if I were driving a shitty car, I would be a dead man.
[after watching The Bicycle Thief]
Great movie, huh? So refreshing to see something like this after all these... cop movies and, you know, things we do. Maybe we'll do a remake of this!

Oh, please! This is Pasadena. We do not arrest the wrong person. That's L.A.!
Let's go to Acapulco.

It's *a* thing to do.
If you've got something to say about me; say it to my face, not behind my back.

How could you let him sell you out? What about truth? Reality?

the next time you want to badmouth me, have the courage to do it to my face. You guys are all the same.
